Ah, MM.  One of the few animes that get a certain score all across the board.  Without further ado, let us begin.
Story (7/10): Raise your hand if you don't know what a masochist is.  By my guess, I would say maybe about 1/2 of the people reading this won't know.  (Just a guess)  A masochist is basically someone who enjoys being abused.  The story of MM is basically following our main protagonist Sadou Tarou, as he tries to get rid of his "intense" masochism by the help of a tsundere that loves abusing people named Mio.  From this,the plot is quite predictable as the main focus has little or no effect on the anime as a whole.  Meaning, any method that is tried ultimately fails to accomplish the goal at hand.  Instead, the anime gets filled with random plot points like a slice of life.  Which, I don't have a problem with as the characters do sort of get closer.  They do spend some time getting into the 2 main female protagonists and giving them something of a backstory, which does fall sometimes on the fact that they give a general gist rather then specific details.  Meaning, there are plot holes and less information then there should be.  


Characters (7/10): Sadou Tarou is your basic male protagonist in any harem anime where he is nice and kind to everyone, while being denser then a brick of gold.  One thing that sets him apart from other harem kings like Junichi from Akane and Rito from To Love-ru, is the fact that he is, a masochist.  Rather then hinting at it, or showing it from time to time, this anime shoves his masochism in your face, every episode.  So much to the point that I got annoyed with it.  Well, to be fair, he did say that he wanted to get rid of it, so it makes a bit of sense.  Next is Yuuno Arashiko.  As the "fanservice" of the anime, Arashiko is a soft spoken girl who is terrified of men.  Due to reasons I wish not to reveal, she will hit any guy who touches her.  Any, guy.  Aside from that, there's not really much to say other then the fact that she does get a "backstory".  Finally, Mio Isurugi.  A tsundere that thinks that she is god.  Yep, that about sums it up.  Mio is a strange person, seeing as how many tsunderes in anime refuse to do anything.  Heading the second volunteering club, she tries to help anyone she can with their problems, and won't stop at trying to help them.  She goes to the extreme to the point that she will seemed obsessed with trying to cure someone's issue.  For example, bringing military grade weapons to cure Tarou's masochism.  Apart from that, she does get a backstory at the very end of the anime, that does bring it to a great end.  Apart from these 3, you have various archtypes that swim in the supporting cast, such as incestuous relatives, a loli, best friend character, and so on and so forth.  


Art and Sound(7/10): The art in MM is brightly colored and vibrant, as well as easy to look at.  It's not bad, but, I'm not too keen on it.  It just looks average for a school anime.  The sound on the other hand is average as well.  It sounds good with its energetic sounding OP and ED, but it's not really that good.  Within the anime are a bunch of mood fillers and nothing else is really standoutish, except the track that appears at the VERY end of the anime.  That is good.


Personal Enjoyment(7/10): When I watched MM, I didn't see it as a harem anime to be honest.  Yes, there were a bunch of girls and such, but I just didn't see it.  (Trust me, I've watched A LOT of harems.) From a comedy aspect, the show excels with its over the top, balls to the wall, "punishment" scenes and "training", seeing as how the main character basically gets thrown out a third story window and skid across the dirt for about 100 meters.  (Not even kidding)  But from a romantic aspect, I could see something budding, but it really wasn't there.  Personally, I would've liked to see more, but seeing as how the Novel's creator has passed away, I guess I won't be getting anything.  In all fairness, MM is not for people who would like a serious plot, rather, if you want to watched something slightly perverted coupled with random comedy and mindless entertainment, then congratulations, MM is for you!

So unforeseeable is the nature of life. Who would have thought this  would be the show I'd write a review for? But here I am. There are some reasons for me doing this. First of all, this show is not well known compared to others in its genre. Secondly, I've finished it in such a short time that I think I just made a new record for myself. (Actually I still think I finished Hentai Ouji quicker but that show was meh). Thirdly, I like the characters in this one. 
Well, let's get to the main part while we're on it. Why you maywant to watch this show? The answer varies. There comes a night when you're supposed to do something but you cannot get your mind to it and find yourself looking for something interesting on the net instead. Unexpectedly, you come across a show that intrigues you because of the masochism theme set in school life. Or you could just be listening to anime ops/eds on Youtube and come across this one's. Regardless, the show is interesting so once you complete the first episode, you reluctantly click on the second, then the  third, and so on. Before long, you have watched all 12 episodes in approximately 4 and a half hours, and the clock ticks morning. That is what happened to me anyway. I didn't find it a waste of time, however. The plot may appear over exploited and repetitive at times but the attempts at humour are spot on. I will spoil you with just one minor (major) cue, there's a freaking spirit bomb. The last eps tend to be a bit boring compared to the first half but saved by the ending, which was fitting in my opinion. 


The art for this show is not something to be amazed by. So is the music. The voice acting is brilliant though. There are some fanservice here and there but you cannot look away from it, otherwise there'd be hardly any anime these days to watch. Apparently the show was adapted from a LN, whose author died mysteriously without giving the series a conclusion. That alone was enough for some to check out the show and see what force was at work behind the scene which caused him to leave early. All in all, this is not a pain to watch like some other ones I have and dropped recently. Hope this helps.

At this point, most people cringe when the words 'harem anime' manages to escape someone's mouth.  The formula is tired and boring, and at most you get a chuckle/giggle by the end of the series. However MM! manages to flip the script, so to speak, by making a unique harem anime.
By making all the characters insane.
Every single character has something wrong with them. The main character is a major MM, masochist/pain lover, there's a girl who think she's a god, another that has a fear of men, a pedophile, a mother and daughter duo that's obsessed with their brother/son, an evil genius...Basically EVERYONE inthis anime is messed up on some level. 


So the plot of this story is that our masochistic lead decides he hates his peculiar fetish and wants to get it fixed. So he goes to a special club run by a kami-dere that tries to make all wishes come true...In the most painful-I mean pleasuring way possible. In the process getting his own harem, and trying to keep his masochism a secret. 


In general I think this was an awesome anime. The characters are all very three dimensional, the harem is given time to make sense, and the main character is so likable that I didn't mind the high school set up.  There's also enough time for the harem to develop. You get the feeling he could get with any of the girls presented. And then you ship them...Hard.


The voice acting in the English and the Japanese are both solid. I personally prefer the English, but you're free to like whatever you like. The character designs are pretty standard, but the art is still lovely. All in all I highly recommend this anime, and think it's a shame that it won't get a second season on account of the novelist's death.

S&M is a genre that I don't like too much, let alone plan to watch if it's the core genre of an anime, but I watched MM for the Harem genre it had. I was disappointed that it didn't have much harem in it, rather it had a lot of comedy and cute romance that made up for it.
Story: 7/10
I don't see many anime that successfully depict perverted characters without leaning in to the Ecchi and in most cases borderline Ecchi genre. MM is an exception to this. There is little to no Ecchi which eases out the plot and makes it more plot heavy(as many Ecchi fans like me agree that Ecchi is somewhat of a plot-killer). Thanks to that, MM wonderfully presented a story about a pervert without Ecchi, a commendable feat which I give a standing ovation too. Nevertheless, even without Ecchi the story wasn't all too great as almost every single episode was a cliche. I don't have much problems with cliche as long as they contain even a pinch of originality in them, which I couldn't see much of in MM. 


Art: 9/10


The art was really good. I don't watch much of Xebec's other anime but for a first impression I'm impressed. It looked really good and fit in with the Masochistic aspect of our MC Tarou. Although the eyes looked quite big on the female characters (especially Yuuno) but it wasn't a bother.


Sound: 7/10


The VAs did a really good job portraying the characters. Sado sounded like a pervert, Mio sounded perfectly like a Tsundere (I should know, I love the Tsundere archetype) and Yuuno also perfectly matched her personality, that of a shy girl. The disappointment comes with the OP/ED as niether appealed to me at all. They sounded fake and lame and wasn't at all fun to listen too. It was so bad that after listening to it in the first few episodes I completely skipped it for the rest of the anime.


Character: 6/10


Character development was present, but was quite disappointing and I won't be kind or overlook it because it isn't a slice of life (which doesn't focus on character development) as MM is not a slice of life anime. I wasn't impressed at all by how the characters developed. Once again I had to witness a second MC to develop while the core MC (Tarou) doesn't develop any character, and I don't mean the DBZ reference. 


Tarou: As I mentioned, Tarou doesn't develop and so he's the exact same person you saw in episode 1, except maybe he has feelings for the other characters, which I don't think counts as character development as he doesn't *change*. Although him not being a huge pervert is a relief as we either have the super straight MC who can't talk to girls or a super pervert who wants to make his own harem, with no one in between. Thankfully Tarou fits in the middle, but I think that's all we can be thankful of, there's nothing much.


Mio: Our resident Tsundere, her character was pretty disappointing (coming from a Tsundere fan) as she falls for him quite late and her actions are more tsun than dere, a situation that's a complete turnoff for any RomCom fan (unless you're a Masochist). Nevertheless, if she wasn't an MC, she would've gotten more praise from me, but she holds back the show. Either I'm not into Tsunderes anymore or TsunDeres are too flawed and cliche driven to satisfy all those hooters who are literal Masochists who have body pillows of their favorite TsunDeres. I guess it's the latter. Because of that, people like me who want a proper Tsundere never get one, as they wanna satisfy the perverted desires of all those snotty teenage boys.


Yuuno: Ah. What a relief. Much like her personality, Yuuno is a relief to write about. The shy girls type, she is androphobic and lashes out at Tarou whenever he touches her. Although cliche, it's bearable knowing that she's not being a Tsundere wannabe. She is the only character who develops wonderfully during the whole anime. And I'm not saying that because if her feelings towards Tarou (which altthough is true, is not a deciding factor of character development as I mentioned before) but how she deals with her androphobic tendencies. Much like Mayo Chiki's Jirou, the way she deals with it is something I'll applaud. You could say that 5 of the 6 points I gave the character section is because of Yuuno


Enjoyment: 8/10


Even though it was riddled by cliches, I enjoyed watching MM because of it's amazing unique comedy and cute soft Romance, it was really satisfying in the end too as unlike other harem anime, this felt kinda like a proper ending. I came for harem, didn't get it but got a good lot of comedy and romance out of MM. Another thing I liked was how the creators rated themselves either S or M in the credits, it looked really nice and felt that the creators like what they're making.


Overall: 7 (7+9+7+6+8/50*10=7.4)


Quite the fun anime. If you're expecting Harem and Ecchi, you'll be severely disappointed but if you came for the Romance and Comedy then you'll really enjoy MM. Although not the best of it's genre, MM can guarantee a cute romance and lots of laughs. It's truly a feel-good anime and cheers you up if you're down. Definitely one of the funniest animes of 2010!


P.S: Yuuno is best girl <3 If traps are allowed Hayama is best girl XD

Story/Characters:
This anime starts out really strong, I mean it's interesting and it's really well written and has a compelling concept, ifonly it were all like that. A little more than half way through the series I feel like this anime kind of just gave up and stopped progressing and became a slice of life show that went fucking nowhere which is really sad considering how much potential this anime had but this show just doesn't follow through or conclude or have a resolution. The ending to this anime wasn't like a cliff hanger or anything but it was just kind of a cop out to me and I was left a little disappointed.\n
The Characters on the other hand were not disappointing, in fact they were the real meat of the show, they all had their own unique problems that they had to face and I found them to be pretty relatable to some extent which is weird considering one guy's a masochist, and another guy's a crossdresser but they play these things off so well.\n\n
Art/Sound:\n
I actually liked some of the characters designs but that's about it. As for the soundtrack, it was kind of forgettable accept for the opening which kind of reminded me of the opening to "Toredora".\n\n
Sub/Dub:\n
The dub for this anime is passable and I would even go as far as saying that it was a little above average but it's nothing that I would get exited about so take your pick on which version you want to watch.\n\n
Final Verdict:\n
I'm giving this anime a 6/10.\n
This anime isn't bad but it really doesn't follow through.

The two main heroines are both equally likeable for their own reasons, and a masochistic protagonist isn't done nearly enough - Tarou is one of the more likeable Harem MCs I've seen in a long time.
If you're a masochist and enjoy women being perversely violent towards you, I think you'll love this in a non-sexual, purely comical way. Even if you're not, it's hilarious and emotionalregardless.

+I like how the MC is a masochist. 
+The characters are fun and likable 
+Solid wacky and zany humor that made me chuckle throughout 
+Solid animation with pretty visual designs 
+The emotions of the series are treated seriously 
+Major props for Yuuno's backstory being treated with seriousness and respect
+A Tsundere main lead that isn't obnoxious
-Sometimes the transitions to a dramatic scene then a comedic scene are pretty off 
-Despite Mio being the main romantic interest- the series puts a lot more focus onthe relationship with Sado and Yuuno. \n
Which I don't have too much of a problem with because Yuuno is my favorite of the girls and I rather have her end up with Sado but... why give the "secondary" love interest the most develop and screen time with the MC if they aren't the main romance? \n\n
Also this is 100% imo and i'm not going to fault the anime for it but i'm just so fed up with the main love interest being tsundere in romcoms.\n\n
But overall this really was a enjoyable anime! It did it's job and it did it very well. if there was ever a season 2 i'd definitely watch it!\n\n

Hey females and fella, first review I’m gonna attempt to write cause I’m bored and I need a reason to finish anime’s I keep delaying, and please don’t kill me over the grammar and chance’s of contradictions I’m honestly just typing this as I watch the show and jotting down the things I see and what not and in all honesty the grammar shit doesn’t matter as long as my point gets across thats all I honestly care about, so enjoy.
This anime is absolutely amazing as a comedy and strictly that,the girlies are cute as shit, art is beautifully bright but easy to look atand the whole super masochism thing I found myself laughing at more times than I can remember. But anything other than that it gets a meh score from me.


Story: There uh really isn’t one. It pretty much goes like this. 

“Fix my problem!”

“Of course I love to help, But I also really wish I was Taiga *Get’s angry*”


Thats about it besides episode 3 which really pissed me off, like the show got super serious Out of no where. I could give two shits about handsome boxer guy (who’s name I’m too lazy to look up). Adding this whole scene with the forced dating scenario and him ending up hitting her was a sad and weak attempt at making us feel sympathetic and giving us an unnecessary explanation for her man-phobia. Which they could just have easily used her parents divorce for. It honestly just completely took me out of the show. Story gets like a 2/10.


Characters: What rhymes with “dish hay” that’s right every body cliche. They literally matched each and every character up with one word and based everything about them with it.


Mio: Tsundere

Taro: Masochist (I know that’s the whole idea of the show but besides masochist his other “redeeming” quality is being the main character so still not much creativity to work with)

Yunoo: Feminist ( Now don’t get triggered, Get it ha! But her whole thing is hating guys and thats it)

Hayama: Yaoi

Noa: Science 

Yumi: Yuri 


I could deal with the weak characters as long as the humor was still present but once they got into the unnecessary serious segments the show literally became back ground noise while I scavenged the collective tab on ifunny. Which i only stopped to look up from when I heard Taro screaming in excitement. Characters get like a 5/10, it’s a cliche for a reason.


Comedy: If it’s your first time watching this show you’ll most likely find yourself laughing multiple times through out. One of the few good things about this show is it’s over-exaggeration of masochism, Taro takes that shit to another level, but sadly even that gets kind of tiresome after one viewing and thats also where the creativity comedy wise stops. The jokes are mediocre at best and with out the whole you’re a pervert so I’ll hit you hard enough to kill you, thing going on which by the way is 80% of the jokes. This show would bomb ever harder than it already has. First Time Viewing: 8/10 (Simply cause it’s my kind of humor)

Repeats: 4/10 (It’s get stale as shit)


Art: This shows biggest redeeming quality. It’s art is super beautiful and super bright while somehow still being easy on the eyes (Even at 3 in the morning). Characters are the brightest and clearest things on the screen which they should be, complementing nicely with the multiple settings. I don’t really have much to say about the art since I’m not much of an art guy myself, so I sadly can’t critique every defining feature of an episode sorry haha. Art: 9/10


That’s sums up a few points to the show there was much more I could have wrote about but decided agonist simply cause I’m lazy and if you’re interested enough in this show to read some random ass person’s review, you can watch the show and see if you enjoy it yourself, every body’s got an opinion for a reason right haha go figure our your own. Overall this show get’s a 6/10.

THIS ANIME! Is for one of the most Out there type animes I know, Now I do not go into a lot if details about animes I review, I just put My own thought of what I think so, if you do not need this type of review then I suggest read another. 
MM! Is a anime about A High school Guy who is a Masochist and he Enjoys being put through pain by the Opposite sex. He in a way does not enjoy this fetish of his so He goes and ask's the Second Voluntary club Of his school for help, Where he meetsa girl who claims she is god and Will Help him be cured from his Masochist


Now like I said I do not go much into it but my thoughts, I am not here to explain everything but add my opinion on it as I am that type of reviewer. 


THIS ANIME Is not so much perverted but its way funny, I laughed constantly as I watched it and sat there with my mouth dropped because They added References from Other animes and do not even try to hide it. Its almost like they ripped it straight out of the other animes themselves and just used it, ITS CRAZY But funnier then hell. 


The story is crazy but it adds in its little side stories to kind of get you attached to some characters and just look at their past a little, so in a way they try to keep you watching, cause if you are like me, Watching a anime with no actual set line plot, its kind of crazy and gets boring.

The Story- MM! is a little anime that came out in 2010 by Studio Xebec that tells the story of a guy named Taro Sado trying to get rid of his  masochistic ways so that he can confess to his love. His friend, Tatsukichi Hayama, recommends he goes to the second volunteer club so that they could cure his problem. When Taro visits the club, he meets Mio Isurugi, a very sweet girl too short for her size, at least that's what she seemed like at first. It was not only 5 seconds later that she showed her true colors, a blond hair tsunderewho proclaims herself as god. Taro also meets Arashiko Yuno, a girl which has a phobia of men and is the reason Taro is a masochist in the first place.


The Review- Oh my f***ing god, this was the worst anime I ever watch this far. I mean the characters are one dementional, the two main female leads don't interest the viewer in the slightest, and the ending is a cliffhanger that doesn't resolve anything.


The Art- Now, I must admit, the art looks good for a 2010 anime, even if it is a piece of crap anime. However, it looks to cartoony, and what I mean is that at the end of every episode, we have the main character blasted into space in a non-realistic way like if he was a member of team rocket (We're blasting off again! *Sparkle*). But, it pulls itself up in the serious scenes of this anime, especially in episode 4.


The Sound- The Opening and End themes are catchy, but after a while, I found myself skipping theme because the lyrics and the sequences were stupid as all get out. None of the background music stood out and basically just left me bored in every scene until a "funny moment" occurred.


The Characters- My favorite character was Yumi Mamiya, mostly because she made the whole anime worth it every time she was on screen. Also because YURI! As for the other characters, the main protagonist is just another pervert with a nice side who gets hit around by the loli- er, I mean tsundere of the show every time he's in his "masochist state". Then, there is the females, who drag this show down. There is Arashiko Yuno who hits the main character every time she even touches him or vise versa, even if she loves him. Then there is the worst female in any anime ever besides  School Days, Mio Isurugi, the tsundere of the show. Not only does she have a god complex, but she is also mentioned to be a sadist who hits the main character and puts him through hell for her own pleasure, which makes this x10 worse because she's suppose to help him in the first place.


Overall- I give this show a 4/10. Why? Because this show is a waste of time and space. You could just watch episodes 1-4 and call it a day. Even the ending is mediocre. SPOILER!!! In the ending, there is no confession, no moment of truth, no anything (except a little fanservice for the pervert inside us all.) The two female leads have a competiton to help two stores get customers and they set up a birthday party for a little girl, only to find out it was Mio's birthday all along (aww *throws up from the writer giving the tsundere sympathy). So, while the main character destracts Mio (i.e he says the one thing you're never suppose to call a tsundere) the other characters set up a party for Mio, which they celebrate to end the show. After the show, I literally sat still, looking at the black screen on my tablet, wondering WTF did I just watch.


DON'T WATCH THIS ANIME! GO WATCH HYOUKA, AT LEAST THEY KNOW HOW TO WRITE A GREAT SHOW!

Please bare with me as I review this anime with my somewhat horrible grammar and me trying to not be a bias.
Anyway, let's move on.
Story - 9: Our plot starts with a unique character named Sado Taro, a masochist. One day he decided he should find a way to get rid of it. He encountered a girl name Isurugi Mio, which in term is the club president and promised that she will do anything and everything to cure his masochism. The series was full of laughter as our main female protagonist failed several times trying to cure his masochism. As the story went on, theydeveloped their feelings or each other, with them having different feelings for each others as the story went on.\n
Art and Sound - 8: The art and sound is not really something to brag about though the anime did quite a good job on choosing their scenery and settings as the story move on with some moments that will touch your heart.\n
Character - 9: The characters are perhaps one of MM's strong point, with our characters have their own personal problems as well as their feelings that are fabulously developed and well played. The story continue with each characters gradually and kind of overcoming their phobia. \n
Enjoyment and Overall - 9: I liked "MM!" with it's story line and characters which are properly designed as well as the settings with fillers and others characters that come along with it. I found the anime quite interesting to watch, hilarious, and heart warming. I definitely recommend this to anyone that want to try something unique.\n
Thank you for reading my first review as well as probably and possible putting up with my grammar. Have a good day folks!

What an odd yet silly anime.  The character's all have some weird or strange behavior or habits.  Sado is a sadist.  He enjoys being hit, beaten, stomped, kicked, or any other type of physical punishment immensely.  He knows it's odd and as much as he'd like to have the typical relationship with a girl he can't.  Girls start coming into his life and the funny part is they all have some weird thing going on with them as well.  Isurugi takes masochism to a whole new level and is constantly trying to "help" Sado with his problem.  Yuunois deathly afraid of boys and boys touching her.  So if you get where this is going the anime is all around an odd combination of strange behavior and comprised of odd moments where you may find humor.  There were things I liked about this anime and there were things I didn't like about this anime.  Some of the things I liked about this anime is that they weren't serious about it.  They made it funny, silly, and ridiculous.  If you like this type of anime, and the typical guy who has four or five girls who likes him but he may not even realize it than this is something for you.  I gave it a lower score because I don't always like those anime.  As there are funny parts in the anime I didn't find it all that appealing.  There is better out there if you like harem, romance, or even ecchi.

Having a problem is one thing and admitting it to people takes guts beyond what most people have. But to end up gaining friends also with problem but still treat you equally as everyone helps one another to get over their problem, is a whole new level of heartwarming life stories.
MM! is the story of one male Masochist character who decides he needs to get help for solving his masochism. The help he finds is certainly unexpected and what he learns about the other members of his newly joined club are just as unexpected as the plans they come up with to "help" one another.While nothing in terms of "curing" anyone really progresses, the story seems to be one of making good memories from school and attempt to solve the little issue in life before they never get a chance to later on.


Art style seems to be a main character focus only, style as you can tell if they don't have odd colored hair, they don't have much to do with the main story. Many things are bright, vibrant colors that catch the eye but can sometimes be too colorful as even in sad moments the scene can be ruined by everything being too joyous a color. This aside shading and tones only seem to exist either in sunrise/sunset, night illumination scenes and angered individual scenes. everything else that is the majority of the anime, are simplistic cell shading that almost makes it seem boring


Music on the occasion its used is fairly par as when its playing, it's either an over the top comical scene or a major emotional keystone in the story with little to none, BGM in the rest of the show. Sounds as well are fairly sub standard as not much at all is original content and most sound effects are stock samples. Opening and ending themes are hard to like as well, with starting off decent, they quickly get overboard to try too hard to keep their theme and end up going way the chart to sounding pleasing.


Characters are possibly the one thing done decently in MM! (Except the main characters family which come off as highly annoying and pointless to the show) While everything else is hugely over the top, characters are always having new flaws revealed instead of being a god complex throughout the entire show. (except for the one character introduced half way through that the anime honestly would be better off without) The main flaws and problems that each character has are quickly brought to light because of the club's goal as well as proper back stories as to why and are slowly (some only attempted) fixed as their progression is easily noted later on.


Lastly enjoyment. Put simply, yes it was humorous. No, I personally did not enjoy it. To get the over the top biased out of the way, I found my self constantly pausing the anime and doing other things, not wanting to go back to this anime because of the times it goes far beyond ridiculous. The believable humor is good and will produces a few chuckles and laughs. However when referencing another anime, MM! sometimes forgets what it it's about and goes completely alien towards it own genre in an attempt to be funny that ends up crashing with enough force that could kill its own animators.
